3.text: Word up Foodtubers, Mr Oliver here, I hope you're all very, very well.

7.text: I'm going to be giving to you a fail safe BBQ sauce recipe

10.text: It works every single time. It's good on pork, it's good on chicken. You're gonna love it.

14.text: I'm gonna cook with really humble chicken drumsticks and chicken thighs

21.text: 200 grams of ketchup. 4 Tablespoons of Worcester Sauce

25.text: then we're gonna go in with some Chipotle Tabasco

43.text: The alcohol is going to disappear, so don't worry it's not an alcoholic BBQ sauce, but it's going to give amazing flavour.

49.text: and then about four tablespoons of Balsamic Vinegar. We'll seaon it with a little salt.

54.text: Get that on a high heat, whisk it up, we're gonna bring it to the boil and simmer it for about 5-10 minutes.

58.text: Til it's a nice sticky, claggy coat the back of a spoon texture

63.text: Right and that's what we want, it's a glaze ok.

66.text: So here I've got my lovely free range chicken. Let's create a rub.

69.text: For me the point of a rub is to begin the story, it's kinda that depth of flavour.

73.text: So, fennel seeds. 2 heap teaspoons of that. 1 level teaspoon of cumin.

78.text: 1 heaped teaspoon of smoked paprika. Smells incredible. About a teaspoon of sea salt

84.text: Pepper. 1 heap tablespoon of lovely golden caster sugar

88.text: and give it a good old bash up.

99.text: I feel the same way about him often as well...

101.text: Ok Buds, we're making a rub. Watch Daddy...

107.text: Well done Buds, that's lovely. He's gonna be a chef one day, I can feel it.

111.text: an you shake that over for me darling

117.text: Can you do it that way? That's it onto that chicken.

122.text: Onto it. Over here... that's good.

126.text: Yep that's it... yep, throw the pestle and mortar onto it. That's exactly what I asked for...

132.text: Can I have a kiss? I love you, you're a good boy.

137.text: So i'm just going to rub the rub over the chicken

142.text: So son, now I'm going to put it in the oven for about 1 hour at 180 degrees celcius

151.text: Here's one I made earlier. You can see the chicken's been nicely cooked

155.text: Just take the thigh and completely submerge it into our barbecue sauce

160.text: to get that perfect glaze on your perfect chicken

166.text: What we do now, is we put this back in the oven and I'm going to turn the oven down to about 100.

171.text: I'll just leave that for like maybe 10-20 minutes

176.text: of course we know the best barbecue ribs and chicken and barbecue sauce it happens outside over fire

182.text: In England it's raining a lot

184.text: I've got some woodchips here, apple oak. We just set it on fire here

188.text: It gives you an amazing smoke, so it's like a little mini smoker

192.text: That'll just slowly smoulder and it's just a really cool way of getting extra flavour into your food.

198.text: What you could do is after about 10 minutes, you can do a double dip, to get double glaze.

203.text: Our home smoker is working, very very well

206.text: So, 20 minutes has passed, have a little look at this guys

210.text: You've got the rub, the slow cooking, the double dip in the beautiful barbecue sauce

218.text: Yes and does Buddy like chili?... Why don't you like chili?

224.text: now I'm gonna give you the one without chili on.. ok.. that's the bone

239.text: You mean spicy, there was smoked paprika in there that I didn't tell you about

249.text: Yeah I'm sorry I should have told you... is this bad parenting?

255.text: Maybe not for young kids, at three and a half, admittedly.

258.text: But for big boys and girls around the world... yes

263.text: Absolutely delicious. So there you go guys, that's my fail safe bbq sauce recipe.

267.text: I hope you enjoyed it. From me and Buddy, bye bye... Say goodbye son

275.text: Just try and be professional, we're going to have take 4 ok?
